solution.text:
By using Pythagoras theorem, \((BC)^2=_{{j*13}}_^2-_{{j*12}}_^2\)
\(BC=_{{5*j}}_\)
Now we can find tan(c)=\(AB\over BC\)=\(_{{j*12}}_\over _{{j*5}}_\)
tan(a)=\(BC\over AB\)=\(_{{j*5}}_\over _{{j*12}}_\)
similarly cot(a)=\(1\over tan(a)\)=\(1\over _{{j*5}}_/_{{j*12}}_\)
Hence, tan(c)-cot(a)=0

content.text:
Find the value of \(tan(c)-cot(a)\), where a=angle(CAB) and c=angle(BCA).
The dimensions of the right angled triangle ABC are:
AB=_{{12*j}}_cm, AC=_{{13*j}}_cm
